intro: [WRONG START] Verbascum × dirupataan, commonly known as the hybrid mullein, is a flowering plant belonging to the genus Verbascum in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is a hybrid species resulting from the cross between Verbascum blattaria and Verbascum phlomoides, exhibiting characteristics of both parent species. The plant is known for its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in height. It produces showy yellow or orange flowers in clusters, which bloom in late summer. Verbascum × dirupatae is often found in disturbed soils and open areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained conditions.
